title: Telegram API Overview
body_html:
Telegram Bot API Details

1. Receiving Messages

Telegram sends updates to your bot via the getUpdates method or via webhooks. Updates contain various types of content, including messages.

2. Message Object

The Message object represents a message. It includes fields like:

  • message_id: Unique message identifier.
  • from: Sender of the message.
  • chat: Conversation the message belongs to.
  • date: Date the message was sent.
  • text: For text messages, the actual text.

3. Sending Messages

You can send messages using the sendMessage method. Key parameters include:

  • chat_id: Unique identifier for the target chat.
  • text: Text of the message to be sent.

4. Asynchronous Operation

The documentation doesn't explicitly mention asynchronous operations. However, libraries like python-telegram-bot and aiogram provide asynchronous implementations. These libraries are recommended for handling messages without blocking Letta's main processes.

Library Comparison

Feature python-telegram-bot aiogram
Syntax More traditional Modern, asyncio-focused
Framework More basic More structured
Learning Curve Easier for beginners Steeper learning curve
Flexibility Very flexible Flexible, with more built-in features
Community Larger, more mature Growing, active
Dependencies Fewer More

5. Webhooks

Using webhooks allows Telegram to push updates to your bot in real-time.
